<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 124, 87]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 102, 677, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space, \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space, \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space, \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge, \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant, \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass constant, \(u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron, \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton, \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant, \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant, \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant, \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant, \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall, \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 108, 558, 145]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 195, 536, 225]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 262, 570, 295]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 339, 608, 375]]<|/det|>

\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 459, 592, 477]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 490, 528, 513]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 528, 592, 545]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 561, 624, 579]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 594, 560, 610]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 628, 580, 645]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[444, 655, 536, 689]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 875, 107]]<|/det|>
The velocity vector diagram for an aircraft heading due north is shown to scale in Fig. 1.1. There is a wind blowing from the north-west.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 672, 183, 691]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 267, 875, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 710, 876, 744]]<|/det|>
A different isotope of hydrogen is hydrogen-2 (deuterium). Describe the similarities and differences between the atoms of hydrogen-2 and hydrogen-3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 820, 878, 838]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
